meanings.definition: To deliberately destroy or damage property.
meanings.sent1: The naughty kids vandalize the playground by scribbling on the walls.
meanings.sent2: The vandals vandalize the park benches by scratching them with sharp objects.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous raccoon tried to vandalize the picnic area by knocking over all the trash cans.
meanings.sent4: The storm seemed to vandalize the peaceful town, leaving destruction in its wake.
meanings.sent5: The graffiti artist's spray paint cans were his tools to vandalize the city streets.

meanings.sent1: The bullies vandalize the school textbooks by tearing out pages.
meanings.sent2: The hooligans vandalize the public restroom by drawing inappropriate images on the walls.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy tried to vandalize the garden by digging up all the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The harsh winter frost seemed to vandalize the delicate flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The artist accidentally vandalized her own painting by spilling paint all over it.
